title: Markets: Bitcoin, Ethereum up, Cardano leads gains - Yahoo Finance
summary:
Here is a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

Bitcoin and Ethereum were little changed, while Cardano led gains with 1.65%. BNB lost the most, down 0.96%. US equity markets closed lower on Friday, and US and Hong Kong markets are closed on Monday for New Year's Day. OKB and OKT tokens gained 15% and 13% respectively during Asia trading hours.

title: Quant (QNT), Decentraland (MANA) and One Ethereum-Based Altcoin Showing Good Signs for 2023: Santiment - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Santiment, a market analytics firm, identifies three altcoins (Quant, Decentraland, and Enjin) with promising signs for 2023. These coins have seen a sharp decrease in supply on crypto exchanges, which could lead to increased price action. However, Bitcoin suffered a "sputtering" end to 2022, with deep-pocketed investors unloading $10.75 billion worth of Bitcoin over the past 12 months. The article concludes by emphasizing that investments in cryptocurrency are high-risk and should be done with caution.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction 2023: When Will The Bear Market End? Watch This Key Pattern - Bitcoinsensus
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

The cryptocurrency market had a dismal 2022, with massive losses across the board, including a 65% loss for Bitcoin and a 68% loss for Ethereum. The bear market is expected to continue in 2023, with the key pattern to watch being the Descending Channel Pattern in the weekly timeframe. If Ethereum continues to trade within this pattern, it could signal more selling pressure and potentially a lower bottom. However, if the ETH price can break above this channel, it could be a sign of a new bull run. The first quarter of 2023 will be critical in determining the trend for Ethereum, and traders should keep an eye on sell setups in the lower timeframes.

title: Can the SEC declare Bitcoin a security and destroy the market? Lawyer Deaton says SEC too powerful - Crypto News Flash
summary: The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is considering whether Bitcoin is a security, with some lawyers arguing that it could be declared as such and potentially destroy the market. Attorney John Deaton has labeled Bitcoin as a security and warned that the SEC could turn on the digital asset. Evan Van Ness, an Ethereum maximalist, tweeted that the Bitcoin production block is controlled by two entities. Former SEC enforcement attorney John Reed Stark questioned why Bitcoin is not regarded as a security that requires SEC registration. The article also mentions that some SEC officials have discussed Bitcoin's security status in the past. Bitcoin and Ethereum maximalists' support for the SEC could backfire, and some experts believe that the SEC's actions could set a precedent for how they handle other digital assets.

title: ETH Price Prediction - 2023 and Beyond for Ethereum - Inside Bitcoins

Investors are advised to conduct due diligence before investing in any token, as the predictions are based on uncertain market trends. Ethereum is considered one of the safest investment choices in crypto due to its established market presence and infrastructure.

title: NVIDIA RTX 4080 Generates a Mere $0.72 Mining Ether Per Day and $21 Per Month - Hardware Times
summary: NVIDIA RTX 4080 generates only $0.72 in Ethereum mining per day and $21 per month, according to a recent test. Despite being paired with high-end hardware, the mining performance was disappointing, with the card netting only 0.00004349 BTC daily. The test highlights the challenges of mining Ethereum and the need for alternative sources of income to offset electricity costs in developed countries.
